newsitem.title: USA: Beacon to buy buildings, offer 7 mln shrs.
newsitem.headline: Beacon to buy buildings, offer 7 mln shrs.

text.p: Beacon Properties Corp said Wednesday it plans to buy eight office buildings totaling over two million square feet for an aggregate price of $339 million.
The company added in a release that it expects to begin a public offering of seven million shares of common stock in early April to help finance the acquisitions.
Beacon said the eight buildings are located in suburban markets of Chicago, Los Angeles and northern Virginia, all areas previously targeted by the company for portfolio expansion.

Beacon said it expects $153 million of net proceeds from the public offering will be required for the $339 million in acquisitions, with the surplus applied to a reduction in the outstanding balance on the company's revolving credit line.
The remainder of the purchase price will be met by the issuance of $50 million in operating partnership units and the assumption by Beacon of $136 million in fixed-rate debt.
The acquisitions are expected to close during the second quarter of 1997, subject to the completion of due diligence and customary closing conditions, the company said.

The acquisitions will increase Beacon's total portfolio to 112 buildings encompassing 17.8 million square feet, and raise the proportion of the company's suburban office properties to 79 percent, Beacon added.
